Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I started to write a new low-level RPC last night, z_createrawtransaction: https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/commit/1bcec40b97eed5085d69793f94697fbba80a22b0

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it will allow a node to generate a shielded transaction, and then give it to another node to broadcast to the network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> just like normal raw transactions work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this will help increase privacy of nodes, because you can give your xtn to a different node with a different IP

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this can help privacy with or without Tor, because a passive network observer can no longer say "if i see a shielded xtn get submitted to the network from node A, then node A made the xtn", it breaks that assumption

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is also really good for hardware wallet support of shielded transactions, because usually making, signing + sending an xtn crosses the boundary of the hardware wallet and the software on your computer that talks to it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> also, if you have a lot of funds, you can separate the computer which has all your funds from the internet entirely, and only allow it to make raw transactions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then use a QR code or something like that to put that transaction onto a computer with internet access, and that submits it to the network. Many whales probably do something like this for transparent addresses, but it's not possible with current tech on zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/zcash/zcash/issues/2666 is what got me started
